original: Eliasson, Karl Georg, överingenjör, Göteborg, f. 14/7/84 i Halmstad av byggmäst. Jöns E. o. Christina Andersson. G. 38 m. Solveig Margareta Wahlström. — Elev v. Halmstads h. a. 1. t. 99, avg:ex. fr. CTL (E) 06, stud. v. Techn. Hochschule i Karls-ruhe 06-07. Res. t. Tyskl., Schweiz, Ital., Österr., Frankr., Engl., Danm., Norge o. Finl. 12-39. Inställ :ing. v. Luth & Roséns Elektr. A-B i Gbg 06, assist, v. eltekn. lab. v. CTI 07-15, ing. v. prof. Fr. H. Lamms Eltekn. Byrå i Gbg 07-11, v. elektr. prövn:anst. byrå i Gbg 11-12, egen konsult, eltekn. ing:byrå o. eltekn. lab. i Gbg sed. 12, konsult, ing. v. elverken i Varberg, Lysekil, Kungälv, Kungsbacka, Mölndal o. Mellerud, besiktn:man. V. ordf. i Tekn. samf. i Gbg 45-46, ordf. i Tekn. samf. museikomm., led. av styr. f. Sv. konsult, ing. fören., ordf. i Sv. be-siktn:m:fören. Medl. av Odd Fellow, Par Bricole o. Bachelor’s club. Hob-bies: pistolskytte, smalfilm. RNO, RVO, RFinlLO, ProPatrstGM, Patrst-GM.
translated: Eliasson, Karl Georg, chief engineer, Gothenburg, born July 14, 1884 in Halmstad to builder Jöns E. and Christina Andersson. Married in 1938 to Solveig Margareta Wahlström. He attended Halmstad's high school from 1899 to 1906, graduated from CTL (E) in 1906, and studied at the Technische Hochschule in Karlsruhe from 1906 to 1907. He traveled to Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Austria, France, Denmark, Norway, and Finland from 1912 to 1939. His professional career started at Luth & Roséns Elektr. A-B in Gothenburg in 1906. He then became an assistant at the electrical technology laboratory at CTI from 1907 to 1915, an engineer at Professor Fr. H. Lamms Eltekn. Byrå in Gothenburg from 1907 to 1911, and an engineer at the electrical testing agency in Gothenburg from 1911 to 1912. From 1912 he ran his own electrical engineering consulting firm and laboratory in Gothenburg, where he was a consultant and engineer for the power plants in Varberg, Lysekil, Kungälv, Kungsbacka, Mölndal, and Mellerud and conducted inspections. He was vice chairman of the Swedish Institute of Engineering in Gothenburg from 1945 to 1946, chairman of the museum committee, a member of the Swedish Engineering Consultants Association, chairman of the Swedish Inspectorate Association, and a member of the Odd Fellow, Par Bricole, and Bachelor's Club. His hobbies included shooting and amateur film-making. He was a recipient of RNO, RVO, RFinlLO, ProPatrstGM and Patrst-GM honors.

structured.name: Karl Georg Eliasson

hasOccupation.name: Prof. Fr. H. Lamms Eltekn. Byrå
Karl Georg Eliasson's Electrical Engineering Consulting Firm and Laboratory

structured.description: Karl Georg Eliasson was a Swedish chief engineer born in Halmstad to builder Jöns E. and Christina Andersson on July 14, 1884. He graduated from Halmstad's high school in 1906 and went on to attend CTL (E) and the Technische Hochschule in Karlsruhe from 1906 to 1907. From 1912 to 1939 he traveled to various countries including Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Austria, France, Denmark, Norway, and Finland. Karl worked as an engineer and consultant for various organizations including Luth & Roséns Elektr. A-B, CTI, and his own electrical engineering consulting firm and laboratory. His clients included the power plants in Varberg, Lysekil, Kungälv, Kungsbacka, Mölndal, and Mellerud. He was also a member and held various positions in organizations such as the Swedish Institute of Engineering, the Odd Fellow, Par Bricole, and Bachelor's Club. Karl Georg Eliasson had hobbies such as shooting and amateur film-making and was the recipient of RNO, RVO, RFinlLO, ProPatrstGM, Patrst-GM honors.
